topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Working with ESX Clusters

body.p: In the undercloud, you register your vCenter and import the clusters from the EON data of the registered vCenter. These resources are available in your cloud after registration and it can be allocated for the usage of cloud.
You can perform the following activities in the Horizon undercloud dashboard.

section.title: Activate clusters
section.p: Perform the following steps to activate clusters:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Overcloud and then select Configure to open Configured Cloud page.
Click Activate Clusters on the top right corner of the page to configure the clusters for the cloud. The page navigates to Configure ESX Computes page.
Select the desired cluster(s) from the Available vCenter Choices box list. The selected cluster(s) is displayed in the Selected vCenter Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available vCenter Choices box to select all the displayed clusters.
Click → to move the selected clusters in the Selected vCenter Choices box list.

(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected vCenter Choices box to remove all the listed clusters. OR Select the desired cluster(s) from the Selected vCenter Choices box list and click ← to move the selected cluster (s) in the Available vCenter Choices box.
Click Configure. After successful configuration of clusters a message is displayed. The configured cluster(s) get listed in the in the Activated Clusters table.
In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Overcloud and then select Configure to open Configured Cloud page.
Click Deactivate Clusters on the top right corner of the page to deactivate the clusters for the cloud. The page navigates to Deactivate ESX Clusters page.
Select the desired cluster(s) from the Available vCenter Choices box list. The selected cluster(s) is displayed in the Selected vCenter Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available vCenter Choices box to select all the displayed clusters.
Click → to move the selected clusters in the Selected vCenter Choices box list.

(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected vCenter Choices box to remove all the listed clusters. OR Select the desired cluster(s) from the Selected vCenter Choices box list and click ← to move the selected cluster (s) in the Available vCenter Choices box.
Click Deactivate. After successful deactivation of clusters a message is displayed.

section.title: Restore a Proxy
section.p: You can restore failed or deleted compute proxies. Select a vCenter to restore its compute proxy. Ensure that you remove any existing compute proxy VM (if any) from the vCenter before proceeding.

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Overcloud and then select Configure to open Configured Cloud page.
Click Restore Proxy on the top right corner of the page to deactivate the clusters for the cloud. Restore Compute Proxy box is displayed.

ol.li: Click vCenter drop-down list and select the vCenter.
